briefdescription.para: This function is used to let a user/admin login on the device.

detaileddescription.para:
s
Pointer to an already allocated se3_session object where to store current logged in session
dev
Device you want to login to
pin
Password to login
access
see AccessLogin
It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h Before issueing any command to the device, you need to login. Some operations are allowed only to the admin user. After a flash erase, the admin pin and the user pin are both a sequence of 32 0s, please use L1_set_admin_PIN or L1_set_user_PIN to change them.

briefdescription.para: This function is used to change the current admin pin.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to current se3_session, you must be logged in as admin to issue this command
New pin to be set

simplesect.para: It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h

briefdescription.para: This function is used to change the current user pin.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to current se3_session, you must be logged in as admin to issue this command
New pin to be set

simplesect.para: It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h

briefdescription.para: This function is used to logout from the device.

detaileddescription.para:
s
Current session you want to end
It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h After issueing this function, you will be forbidden to perform any command on the device. This can also be used to free the allocated resources, such as cryptographic sessions, with just one call.

memberdef.argsstring: (se3_session *s, uint16_t skip, uint16_t max_keys, se3_key *key_array, uint16_t *count)
memberdef.name: L1_key_list

briefdescription.para: This function is used get the list of the already of the already available keys on the device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to current se3_session, you must be logged in
How many keys you want to skip from the beginning of the list
How many keys you want to retrieve from the device
Pointer to the already allocated array where to store the keys
Effective number of retrieved keys

simplesect.para: It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h

briefdescription.para: This function is used to edit the keys data on the device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to current se3_session, you must be logged in
see KeyOpEdit
Key value you want to add/update/delete

simplesect.para: It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h

memberdef.argsstring: (se3_session *s, uint16_t algorithm, uint16_t mode, uint32_t key_id, uint32_t *sess_id)
memberdef.name: L1_crypto_init

memberdef.argsstring: (se3_session *s, uint32_t sess_id, uint16_t flags, uint16_t data1_len, uint8_t *data1, uint16_t data2_len, uint8_t *data2, uint16_t *dataout_len, uint8_t *data_out)
memberdef.name: L1_crypto_update

memberdef.argsstring: (se3_session *s, uint16_t algorithm, uint16_t mode, uint32_t key_id, size_t datain_len, int8_t *data_in, size_t *dataout_len, uint8_t *data_out)
memberdef.name: L1_encrypt

briefdescription.para: This function is used to encrypt a buffer of data given the algorithm, the encryption mode, the buffer size, and where to store the encrypted data.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to current se3_session, you must be logged in
Which algorithm to use, see AlgorithmAvail
This parameter strictly depends on the which algorithm is chosen
Which key ID to use for encryption
How long is the buffer you want to encrypt
Pointer to the buffer
How many data were actually encrypted
Pointer to a pre-allocated buffer where to store the cipher text

simplesect.para: It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h

memberdef.argsstring: (se3_session *s, uint16_t algorithm, uint16_t mode, uint32_t key_id, size_t datain_len, int8_t *data_in, size_t *dataout_len, uint8_t *data_out)
memberdef.name: L1_decrypt

briefdescription.para: This function is used to decrypt a buffer of data given the algorithm, the decryption mode, the buffer size, and where to store the decrypted data.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to current se3_session, you must be logged in
Which algorithm to use, see AlgorithmAvail
This parameter strictly depends on the which algorithm is chosen
Which key ID to use for decryption
How long is the buffer you want to decrypt
Pointer to the buffer
How many data were actually decrypted
Pointer to a pre-allocated buffer where to store the clear text

simplesect.para: It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h

memberdef.argsstring: (se3_session *s, uint16_t algorithm, size_t datain_len, int8_t *data_in, size_t *dataout_len, uint8_t *data_out)
memberdef.name: L1_digest

briefdescription.para: This function is used to sign a buffer of data given the algorithm, the amount of data to sign and where to store them.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to current se3_session, you must be logged in
Which algorithm to use, see AlgorithmAvail
How long is the buffer you want to sign
Pointer to the buffer
How many data were actually signed (can be NULL)
Pointer to a pre-allocated buffer where to store the digest

simplesect.para: It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h

memberdef.argsstring: (se3_session *s, uint16_t skip, uint16_t max_algorithms, se3_algo *algorithms_array, uint16_t *count)
memberdef.name: L1_get_algorithms

briefdescription.para: This function is used to retrieve a list from the device of available algorithms.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to current se3_session, you must be logged in
How many algorithms you want to skip from the beginning of the device list
How many algorithms you want to retrieve from the device
Pointer to the already allocated array where to store the algorithms
Effective number of retrieved keys

simplesect.para: It returns SE3_OK on success, otherwise see se3c1def.h
